# Enter your code here. Read input from STDIN. Print output to STDOUT

import sys

def average(marks):
    return sum(marks)/len(marks)

def main():
    # get number of lines
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    # create a dictionary to store key:value pairs
    student_marks = {}
    # get n lines of input
    for i in range(n):
        # split input into name and marks
        name, *line = sys.stdin.readline().split()
        # convert marks to int
        scores = list(map(float, line))
        # store name and marks in dictionary
        student_marks[name] = scores

    # get name of student to query
    query_name = sys.stdin.readline()

    # print average marks for query student
    print("{:.2f}".format(average(student_marks[query_name])))

main()

    query_name = input()
    student_marks = student_marks[query_name]

    print("%.2f" % (sum(student_marks)/3))

"""
=====Solution=====
#!/usr/bin/env python

n = int(raw_input())
student_marks = {}
for _ in range(n):
    line = raw_input().split()
    name, scores = line[0], line[1:]
    scores = map(float, scores)
    student_marks[name] = scores
query_name = raw_input()

print "%.2f" % (sum(student_marks[query_name])/3)
"""
